articles.title: GPT-5 bests human judges in legal smack down
articles.summary:
But that doesn't mean AI is ready to dispense justice

ai-pocalypse  Legal scholars have found that OpenAI's GPT-5 follows the law better than human judges, but they leave open the question of whether AI is right for the job.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses the use of AI (GPT-5) in a judicial decision-making context, which relates to the governance of information technology systems, their alignment with organizational (or legal) objectives, and the oversight of AI deployment in critical functions.

articles.title: How AI could eat itself: Competitors can probe models to steal their secrets and clone them
articles.summary:
Just ask DeepSeek

Two of the world's biggest AI companies, Google and OpenAI, both warned this week that competitors including China's DeepSeek are probing their models to steal the underlying reasoning, and then copy these capabilities in their own AI systems.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses threats to AI models (valuable IP) through probing and cloning, which relates to IT governance concerns like protecting digital assets, managing technology risks, and ensuring secure and ethical use of IT systems.

articles.title: ServiceNow can't seem to keep its wallet closed, snaps up small AI analytics company
articles.summary:
News of the deal came about two weeks after CEO Bill McDermott swore off any “large scale” M&A this year. A spokesperson called this deal a “tuck in.”

Despite its CEO's insistence that it wasn't doing any "large scale" deals soon, ServiceNow has acquired yet another company. This time, the software firm has scooped up Pyramid Analytics, an Israeli corporation with data science and preparation expertise. The goal is to build additional context and semantics into its software stack.…
articles.reasoning: The acquisition aims to enhance ServiceNow's software stack with analytics and semantics, which relates to IT decision-making, architecture, and aligning IT investments with business goals.

articles.title: Investors shove another $30B into the Anthropic money furnace
articles.summary:
$380B valuation for a company that's yet to turn a profit? Sure, why not

The AI bubble continues to inflate with Anthropic's announcement of $30 billion in Series G funding at a $380 billion post-money valuation.…
articles.reasoning: The article highlights revenue growth and future projections versus current lack of profit, touching on the realization of expected benefits from significant investments.

articles.title: Ring kills Flock partnership amid surveillance scrutiny
articles.summary:
Move comes against backdrop of disasterclass Super Bowl ad

Ring has cut ties with Flock, citing resource constraints, mere months after the pair announced a partnership.…
articles.reasoning: The cancellation of the Flock partnership due to unforeseen resource requirements suggests a failure to realize anticipated benefits from the collaboration, touching on benefit realization topics like evaluating project feasibility and managing expected outcomes against constraints.

articles.title: Penguin-powered platform board keels over at Alpine station
articles.summary:
It must be that fresh mountain air

Bork!Bork!Bork!  Just picture it. You're at a Swiss train station, looking for information on your connecting line. You peer up at the platform sign hoping to find out how long you'll be waiting and whether you're standing in the right place. But instead of helpful info, you see "* Installation log files are stored in /tmp." Gee, thanks a lot!…
articles.reasoning: The article describes a public-facing IT system (train station digital signage) failing and displaying an error message, which constitutes an incident requiring logging, diagnosis, and resolution to restore normal service.

articles.title: MPs brand NS&I's £3B IT overhaul a 'full-spectrum disaster'
articles.summary:
Watchdog says savings bank botched tech revamp, warning taxpayers remain exposed after years of delays

Britain's state-backed savings bank has been dragged over the coals by Parliament's spending watchdog, which has branded its long-running digital overhaul a £3 billion "full-spectrum disaster."…
articles.reasoning: The article describes a major IT project failure with ongoing risks and delays, which could involve managing and resolving significant operational incidents or crises stemming from the botched overhaul, though the focus is more on project failure than routine incident handling.

articles.title: Enforcing piracy policy earned helpdesk worker death threats
articles.summary:
Years later, he read about his antagonist doing time for murder

On Call  Welcome to another installment of On Call, The Register's weekly reader-contributed column that tells your tech support tales.…
articles.reasoning: The article describes a helpdesk worker enforcing a policy that led to a severe, disruptive event (death threats and a subsequent murder conviction), which aligns with incident management's focus on restoring normal service operation and minimizing business impact after an unplanned interruption or event.

articles.title: Top Dutch telco Odido admits 6.2M customers caught in contact system caper
articles.summary:
Names, addresses, bank account numbers accessed – but biz insists passwords and call data untouched

The Netherlands' largest mobile network operator (MNO) has admitted that a breach of its customer contact system may have affected around 6.2 million people.…
articles.reasoning: The article details a data breach where attackers accessed extensive personal information (names, addresses, bank details, ID documents), which is a direct outcome of successful information gathering by attackers, a core topic in cyber attack phases.

articles.title: Log files that describe the history of the internet are disappearing. A new project hopes to save them
articles.summary:
The Internet History Initiative wants future historians to have a chance to understand how human progress and technical progress align

APRICOT 2026  For almost 30 years, the PingER project at the USA’s SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory used ping thousands of time each day to measure the time a packet of data required to make a round trip between two nodes on the internet.…
articles.reasoning: The article focuses on the preservation, loss, and potential retrieval of historical internet data (like PingER and Renesys datasets), directly aligning with technologies and challenges in storing and accessing digital information for future analysis.
